												Although it lists me as playing for a mere twelve hours as of this review, I've actually played this game a long time ago, and quite a bit, in all honesty. The game is solid in terms of a Stronghold game (which isn't saying much), but I do have a few problems. Pros- Pretty Decent Graphics for a game released in the early 2000s- The economy system, while much more simple than other games, is still very important in Legends- The Three Factions are surprisingly similar in playstyle, but with just enough differences to make them unique. For example, the Good Side has more emphasis on hero powers than the other factions.- There are three campaigns, each of which provide their own curving difficulty- Dragons. No explaination neededCons- Legends doesn't have a Free-Build Mode, like in previous games.- Multiplayer is 4 player only. Other games in the series have 8 Player multiplayer.- Despite the Combat being much more streamlined and varied, the economy aspect is a downgrade from Stronghold 2's economy. This is all about taste, and, for some, this would be perfectly fine.- The Mythical Units of Legends are powerful, but they really don't change the game all that much. Even the Dragons don't really change the game enough...VerdictThe game is flawed, but so is the rest of the series. If you like deep Castle Sim gameplay, Stronghold 2, to be blunt, is a far better choice. However, I would still recommend Legends, despite its flaws. The game, although it pales in comparison to its predecesor, has enough differences and improvements to warrent at least an hour or two of playtime, at least. If anything, just play the game for the campaign, because even the good side (the easiest) is pretty difficult at the end.Also, this game has dragons, so dragon fans are going to be happy, even if they don't last that long.

												Stronghold Legends has great medieval sights and sounds...esp the music. Totally fitting for the period. The gameplay? Well, I've played every other Stronghold game and the learning curve was gradual and reasonable. In Legends, when I play a skirmish (and to a lesser extent, the campaign) by the time I have begun to put out some archers on my very basic single walls all is lost when enemy catapults show up along with gangs of archers...and this is only five minutes into the game. AND, it's on baby-level easy difficulty! The balance between me and the AI limits my  games to about 20 minutes...no casual planning and admiring your castle that you worked so hard to  build, the enemy will show up when you are a quarter/halfway into your building and, from there, it's a frenetic battle that leaves little time for me to enjoy the game..I spend the time putting out fires. Maybe it's me, but I've completed Stronghold where the difficulty was gradually increased. Legends has me feeling so incompetent it's maddening. These are my major gripes, though....if the AI didn't have all their stuff researched and produced at warp speed, this would be one of my top ten games. I still recommend it, though...a Monarch should be proud, but not SO proud that he dismisses, outright, any incompetent behaviour on his part. No, no...a great leader is more realistic and contemplates his incompetence and, thus, can learn from it.In my opinion, the pro's outweigh the cons.

												My Thoughts on Stronghold Legends....Dear Fire Fly Studios, You have built a great empire with stronghold but it has begun to crumble with each game.You made Crusader…. A decent game with some new things tacked on.Then you made the graphically superior Stronghold 2.Now I had my issues with some of these…. However Stronghold Legends was not only a fail In RTS terms (balance) it was a fail in Simulation terms. That is all of it in a nutshell. (In short)Wait! You’re still reading? Well then I’ll list the good and bad things then.PROSSimple RTS gameplay that has some great value to it like the “spam and rush” type gameplay.The campaign is great! The story follows King Arthur (the good guy), Vlad the Impaler (the bad guy), and much more.Strongholds original soundtrack will always have a good place in my heart.The Steam Workshop maps and mappers.CONSFrost Giants is how you win in multiplayer.Bats are how you win in multiplayer.Knights are how you win in multiplayer.Siege Towers with Crossbowmen on them is how you win in multiplayer.All of the CONS I just listed also apply to singleplayer.SPAM! SPAM! SPAM!ALL OTHER UNITS ARE ALMOST USELESS.Lack of Simulation makes everything Stronghold was….Gone!STRONGHOLD LEGENDS HAS STOPPED WORKING!This game goes so fast that the economy barley exists! (Compared with the older games that is)Final thoughts this game It can still be fun….but with so many problems what can one do?Remaster it and not fix the bugs?AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!LinksNewave will still play this game however I will not recommend it to poor helpless people who don’t know what they are getting themselves in.As these are my thoughts and not others this is how I experienced this game. Yours may be different.

												TLDR: Buy it if you want to know how cool it's to build your Stronghold in glorious 3DDont if you cant stand bugs and stupid stupid stupid AI And this is my rant!So I got the Stronghold bundle long ago but never touches any of it more than 1hrs, i just want to feel the nostalgia on steam. Hundreds of hrs was poured into SHC non-steam though. And then suddenly we got this Stronghold Legend Steam Edition. Let me make this clear:I love Stronghold, I went out to buy Stronghold Crusader 1 day after i tried Stronghold.Stronghold 2 was 3d but the gameplay and engine was pure trash.Then we got Stronghold 3 and Crusader 2 using new engine  with Havok physic for more flashy sieges but those game are not Stronghold.Back a bit to the Original Stronghold Legend. It was the one that stick 80% true to the original game. 20% was the fantasy stuff that annoy the hell out of me. Still when you considering a Stronghold remaster, this one fits the bill. About the game:The graphic is pretty much the same (to me, still meh) The rest you can gather from the store page, they are there.But How the hell, can they break THE GAME. It's already broken when they made it and somehow they manages to break somemore!!!!!!!Play the 1st act of the campaign.................you will notice........when your troops walk, clanking those shiny armours with annoying sounds. And somehow, when they stop, those sounds goes on for 5-10 secs. It's like after they stopped their balls still have some momentum left and keep dangling inside their armour, making those clanking sound.I remember archers can shoot from the ground to kill the guy on the wall and yet in this version, somehow, they cant and what i got is 1 guy left on the wall who manages to snipe down my 40+ archers. REMASTER ? REALLLY ? MORE LIKE "HEY GIV US $$$ AND WE WILL HELP PUT ANOTHER NAIL IN THE STRONGHOLD COFFIN FOR YA"Did i mentioned the game crash when i try Skirmish ?And did i mentioned the game load long as hell ? Like Vlad was doing some dirty thing in the background preventing me to load the game. Even Total War Warhammer loads quicker than this!!!!Please Firefly, make a decent Stronghold like the ones in 2001 and 2002 please. Your latest game is 5$ DIRT CHEAP ON HUMBLE BUNDLE.
